original_text: The Receiving Party agrees to hold in confidence and not disclose to any third party any Confidential Information disclosed by the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party shall use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose of evaluating a potential business relationship between the parties. This obligation shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years.
gold_simplification: The party receiving confidential information must keep it secret and not share it with anyone else. They can only use this information to decide whether to do business together. This secrecy requirement lasts for 5 years, even after the agreement ends.
key_facts: Receiving Party must keep Confidential Information secret
Can only use information for evaluating business relationship
Obligation survives for 5 years after agreement ends
